title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 17 of the Sea Pollution Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea Pollution (Ballast Water
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea Pollution (Ballast Water 

Management Convention) (Amendment) Regulations 2024.

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 17 of the Sea Pollution Act
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Schedule 2
text_raw:
4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Schedule 2 

the following Schedule: 

“SCHEDULE 2 

Regulation 7(3) 

Ballast Water Management System Type Approval Application Form 

Name of Applicant: .............................................................................................. 

Name of Company: .............................................................................................. 

Name of ballast water management system: ........................................................ 

Ballast water management system manufactured by: .......................................... 

Other equipment manufactured by: ...................................................................... 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 27th February, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Has an application for Type Approval for this ballast water management 
system ever been submitted to another Administration? 

[61] 3 

Yes No 

If Yes, please give details: 

…………………………………………………………………………………
…………………………………………………………………………………
…………………………………………………………………………………
…………………………………………………………………………………
………………………………………………………………………………… 

A copy of this Application form should be submitted to the MSO or relevant 
recognised organisation along with the following documentation:

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 17 of the Sea Pollution Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Sea Pollution (Ballast Water Management 
Convention) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 188 of 2023) to allow for the Marine 
Survey Office to delegate certain functions in relation to survey and 
certification to recognised organisations who are recognised in accordance with 
EU Regulation 391/2009. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [61] 5
